Description: Pottery oil lamp fragment. Slightly shouldered, with a volute design on the front of the reservoir. The reservoir is round with a central hole in the top with a concentric ring modelled around it. Exterior covered with a (relatively) thick, 5YR 5/3 (Reddish Brown) slip. Well levigated Delta silt. Fine (sand-size to 1 mm) white, grey and red grit temper with frequent micaceous inclusions of similar size. Fabric c. 5YR 6/3 (Light Reddish Brown). Core ranges from grey, through 10R 5/8 (Red) to 5YR 4/6 (Yellowish Red).
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Great Temenos, South Mound 49150 N.I.491.172 Phase NW2A
Curator's comments: Complete parallel from Naukratis (Bolton Museum 1886.31.1). Similar Egyptian parallels dating to the late 2nd and 1st century BC are in the British Museum (Bailey 1975, British Museum Lamps I, Q594 and Q595 from Naukratis). Further parallels dated late 2nd century to mid 1st century BC (Mlynarczyk 1997, 83, Type M-prime.b.1, Fig. 145). Mlynarczyk, J. 1997. Alexandrian and Alexandria-influenced mould-made lamps of the Hellenistic period. BAR International Series 677.
Bibliographic references: Leonard 1997 / Ancient Naukratis: Excavations at a Greek Emporion in Egypt, Part I: The excavations at Kom Ge’if. (pl. 7.5 ; pg. 289)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (KD.019) (Phase 3)
